TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {20380=Unless otherwise stated you make all the setting changes below by editing the kdeglobals file in the directory %APPDATA%\.kde\share\config\ with any text editor (such as kwrite). (Note that for versions older than 4.0.85 the file is in %USERPROFILE%\.kde\share\config\kdeglobals.) %APPDATA% (and %USERPROFILE%) is different for different Windows users/versions/locales; in a command prompt, entering the command cd %APPDATA% will switch to it, effectively telling you what it is.}
textBeforeTable: Package status and contents Some KDE programs use UNIX-specific features, such as konsole's use of pseudo-terminals, and thus are difficult (read: currently impossible) to port to MS Windows. By design, KDE-windows does not provide the full-blown KDE desktop, a preview on the plasma shell replacement will be available in 4.1.2 - Nevertheless this does not rely on kwin/X11 which means that desktop effects are not available There are many other KDE programs that are not part of KDE 4.0.0 and are not currently packaged for MS Windows. General notes: Multimedia support should work, although video support might be missing (from the backend) Many applications have a generic icon in Windows Explorer. Full-text search in khelpcenter does not work because Perl scripts are disabled. choosing File > Open correctly starts klauncher.exe, kioslave.exe and kded4.exe, and runs kbuildsycoca4.exe as needed. many games run starting a KDE program correctly starts dbus-daemon.exe Using kdewin-installer-gui-0.9.3.exe to install 4.1.3 packages: Status [KFileDialog Settings] Native=false Either set Native to true or false. Add a new section with the lines: To chose native or KDE file dialog: Change native/KDE file dialogs [Locale] Country=** Language=** Replace ** with your lowercase alpha-2 country code, e.g.
